Rust is known for being applicable to a many different levels of programming, but one exciting area that Rust opens up is embedded computing. In this fun workshop we got a taste of working with microcontrollers using Rust. We were generously sponsored so we could provide ESP32 microcontrollers to participants. Participants learned how to

  • connect to the microcontroller and flash it over USB
  • connect the microcontroller to simple electronics
  • interface with sensors
  • buddy a microcontroller with a lightweight SoC

The full documentation for the workshop is available here Workshpop documentation
